===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/inanari/}} → {{IPAchar|/inari/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いなり|稲|tr1=ina|t1=rice plant|生る|alt2=生り|tr2=nari}}, the stem form of verb {{m|ja|生る|tr=naru||to fruit, to go to seed}}.

The {{ja-l|荷}} character might be [[ateji]]. The ''ri'' reading for this kanji is a non-[[w:Jōyō kanji|Jōyō]] [[訓読み#Japanese|''kun'']] reading generally reserved for names.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いなり|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いなり}}

# a kind of [[sushi]], wrapped in [[fried]] [[tofu]], said to be liked by foxes
#: See the {{ja-r|稲荷寿司|いなりずし}} entry for more details.

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|いなり}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=いなり|Shinto}}: god of harvests, fertility, rice, agriculture, foxes, industry, and worldly success
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=いなり}}
# the name of various towns and stations around Japan

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|稲荷大神|^いなり ^おおかみ}}: God Inari
* {{ja-r|稲荷鮨|いなりずし}}: [[sushi]] wrapped in fried [[tofu]]
* {{ja-r|稲荷神社|^いなり じんじゃ}}: a [[shrine]] dedicated to the god Inari, usually with a statue of a [[fox]] in front
* {{ja-r|稲荷講|^いなり ^こう}}: an Inari [[shrine]] [[association]] in Kyōto
